1e00a114-1266-4fff-8023-bea35cb226e9.description: This badge owner is a trained lifestyle coach for PreventT2, an intensive lifestyle change program from the National Diabetes Prevention Program, led by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC.) ADCES is one of a select number of Lifestyle Coach Training Organizations with a CDC memorandum of understanding to deliver this training. Lifestyle coaches activate PreventT2 to help participants make better food choices, increase physical activity, and lose a modest amount of weight.
1e00a114-1266-4fff-8023-bea35cb226e9.name: ADCES Lifestyle Coach PreventT2 Lifestyle Change Program

badge_template_activities.title: Participants must complete 10 hours of interactive training with a certified Master Trainer to learn to apply the PreventT2 curriculum.

f196ce33-a30f-4223-9f92-2ddafbcbd31d.description: Earners of the ADCES Insulin Therapy Certificate have advanced knowledge and skills in applying insulin therapy to the care of people with diabetes.
f196ce33-a30f-4223-9f92-2ddafbcbd31d.name: ADCES Insulin Therapy Certificate

alignments.description: ADCES is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education as a provider of continuing pharmacy education. This program provides 20.5 contact hours (2.05 CEUs) of continuing education credit.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 1-hour recorded webinar activity, "Time in Range: Its About Time!"
Complete the 7-module online course, Insulin Pump Therapy.
Complete the 2-module online course, The Insulin Solution: Overcoming Barriers to Insulin Use.
Complete the 3-module course, Individualizing and Optimizing Self-Monitoring of Blood Glucose (SMBG).
Complete the 3-module online course, Pattern Management (SMBG): Combating Clinical Inertia
Complete a 50-question post-learning assessment and score a 70% or better to pass.

9e713e32-843a-4ed4-98c5-b5a3e1181946.description: Earners of the ADCES Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) in Practice Certificate have advanced knowledge and skills in applying CGM technology to the care of people with diabetes.
9e713e32-843a-4ed4-98c5-b5a3e1181946.name: Putting Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) into Practice Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

alignments.description: In support of improving patient care, ADCES is jointly accredited by the Accreditation Council for Continuing Medical Education (ACCME), the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE), and the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) to provide continuing education for the healthcare team.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a 45-question pre-test.
Complete 8 course modules.
Complete a 45-question post-learning assessment and score 80% or better to pass.

4ec5aafa-1b06-4944-aef2-aeb6a1a37b15.description: ADCES has developed a 6-hour online certificate program on the topics of connected insulin delivery devices and the clinical application of data. The program targets diabetes care and education specialists and other members of the diabetes care team interested in learning more about these topics. Case studies highlight the importance of considering data when working with people who use multiple daily injections of insulin.
4ec5aafa-1b06-4944-aef2-aeb6a1a37b15.name: Connected Insulin Delivery Devices and Clinical Application of Data Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 5 self-paced online learning modules.
Complete a 30-question post-learning assessment and score 70% or better to pass.

0cce7e05-f77c-431d-8852-d985b4e68379.description: Art of Telehealth is a series of five online courses on the subject of Telehealth from ADCES . This structured program uses recorded presentations to offer insights from providers and people with diabetes on best practices in the delivery of telehealth, the development and maintenance of a sustainable telehealth practice.
0cce7e05-f77c-431d-8852-d985b4e68379.name: Art of Telehealth

issuer.summary: issued by Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

entity.name: Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

alignments.name: Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education
alignments.description: The Universal Activity Number is JA4008258-0000-21-508-H01-P; JA4008258-0000-21-508-H01-T. This knowledge-based activity has been approved for 6.5 contact hour(s) This statement contains information provided to NABP from the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) via CPE Monitor®.

alignments.name: American Medical Association (AMA)
alignments.description: Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists designates this activity for a maximum of 6.5 AMA PRA Category 1 Credit(s)TM. Physicians should claim only the credit commensurate with the extent of their participation in the activity.

alignments.name: American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC)
alignments.description: Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists designates this activity for a maximum of 6.5 ANCC contact hours.

alignments.name: American Academy of PAs (AAPA)
alignments.description: The Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists has been authorized by the American Academy of PAs (AAPA) to award AAPA Category 1 CME credit for activities planned in accordance with AAPA CME Criteria. This activity is designated for 6.5 AAPA Category 1 CME credits.

alignments.name: Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR)
alignments.description: CDR Credentialed Practitioners will receive 6.5 Continuing Professional Education units (CPEUs) for completion of this activity.

alignments.name: California Board of Registered Nursing
alignments.description: The Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists is approved by the California Board of Registered Nursing, Provider Number 10977, for 6.5 contact hours. RNs must retain this document for 4 years after the activity concludes.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete the Art of Telehealth learning activities to earn the Art of Telehealth Certificate:  • Optimizing the Telehealth Encounter for Success  - 90 minutes • Utilizing Data from Devices and Patient-Generated Health Data – 60 minutes • Telehealth Best Practices- Lessons Learned – 90 minutes • Telehealth Regulations and Reimbursement – 90 minutes • Development and Maintenance of a Sustainable Telehealth Practice – 60 minutes.
Earners must successfully pass a post-learning assessment of 25 questions with a score of 80% or higher.

0cd9a726-dbfb-4591-b957-9e0d5ebaf105.description: This device demonstration will utilize instructional videos and case studies to demonstrate the features and functionality of the Omnipod 5 Automated Insulin Delivery System, highlighting how to support patients and optimize settings.
0cd9a726-dbfb-4591-b957-9e0d5ebaf105.name: Danatech Device Training: Omnipod 5 Automated Insulin Delivery System

issuer.summary: issued by Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

entity.name: Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

badge_template_activities.title: Upon completion of the training, attendees will understand: Key features and functionality unique to the Omnipod 5 Automated Insulin Delivery System; How to perform key functions and edit system settings that influence optimization; Understand the onboarding process for existing Omnipod users and those new to Omnipod to ensure a smooth transition; Real-world implementation of the Omnipod 5 System that demonstrates improvement in control Highlight key data reports for ongoing management

58f810e0-bcc0-4014-9b26-051a26561f7f.description: This device demonstration will utilize instructional videos and case studies to demonstrate the features and functionality of the Omnipod DASH™ Insulin Management System, highlighting particular aspects that make the therapy well-suited for those living with insulin-requiring type 2 diabetes.
58f810e0-bcc0-4014-9b26-051a26561f7f.name: Danatech Device Training: Omnipod DASH™ System

issuer.summary: issued by Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

entity.name: Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

badge_template_activities.title: Upon completion of the one-hour virtual training, “Danatech Device Training: Omnipod DASH™ System Deep Dive" – attendees will understand: Key features and functionality unique to the Omnipod DASH™ Insulin Management System; How to perform Pod changes • How to customize and deliver bolus doses; How to edit Omnipod DASH™ System settings, including basal rates and Bolus Calculator settings; How to implement the Omnipod DASH™ System for the management of insulin-requiring type 2 diabetes

407aac44-8b2d-4a27-b983-07dbffb8b830.description: Gain experience with the Dexcom G7 system including the new customizable features, all-in-one wearable, and completely redesigned app. Incorporate the Identify, Configure, Collaborate (ICC) Framework to implement and optimize technology-enabled services as we review how to identify candidates for real-time CGM (RT-CGM), configure settings to individualize care, and collaborate regarding diabetes management decisions using Dexcom Clarity.
407aac44-8b2d-4a27-b983-07dbffb8b830.name: Danatech Device Training: Dexcom G7 is Made for More

issuer.summary: issued by Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

entity.name: Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

badge_template_activities.title: At the completion of this program you will be able to: identify candidates for RT-CGM by understanding the components and features of Dexcom G7; configure the Dexcom G7 and Clarity Apps to enhance use and improve outcomes; and collaborate alongside people with diabetes using shared decision-making while reviewing Dexcom Clarity reports

be81ad3a-06be-4400-aa4b-1adb4780cc0e.description: This program will provide learners with educational information and skills about diabetes and other cardiometabolic conditions. This education will increase their capacity to effectively support Novo Nordisk customers in their efforts to apply these principles and achieve better care outcomes.
be81ad3a-06be-4400-aa4b-1adb4780cc0e.name: ADCES Certificate in Diabetes and Other Cardiometabolic Conditions

issuer.summary: issued by Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

entity.name: Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

alignments.name: Joint Accreditation for Interprofessional Continuing Education
alignments.description: In support of improving patient care, ADCES is jointly accredited by the Accreditation Council for Continuing Medical Education (ACCME), the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE), and the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) to provide continuing education for the healthcare team.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 9 recorded webinars (totaling 12 hours).
Complete 8 case study activities, designed to help the learner apply what they learned in each webinar.
Pass a 30-question post-learning final assessment with a minimum score of 80%.

44117837-39a5-40d8-a5f5-507aa8d34ec6.description: The Identify, Configure, Collaborate (ICC) Framework, recently adopted by ADCES, guides healthcare professionals to implement and optimize technology-enabled services in a standardized way. In this danatech device training, you will gain a deeper understanding of the Dexcom G6 Real-Time Continuous Glucose Monitoring (RT-CGM) System and the power of data analysis with Dexcom Clarity software by implementing the ICC framework to simplify clinician workflow and improve diabetes management.
44117837-39a5-40d8-a5f5-507aa8d34ec6.name: Danatech Device Training: Enhance Your Use of the Dexcom G6 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System: Apply the Identify, Configure, Collaborate (ICC) Framework

issuer.summary: issued by Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

entity.name: Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

badge_template_activities.title: Upon completion of the one-hour virtual training, attendees will be able to: 1) identify candidates for RT-CGM by understanding the components and features of Dexcom G6; 2) configure the Dexcom G6 and Clarity apps to enhance use and improve outcomes; and 3) collaborate alongside people with diabetes using shared decision-making while reviewing Dexcom Clarity reports.

50eda5d6-9612-4158-a179-bbb251ce7d74.description: Join Amy Hess-Fischl, MS, RDN, LDN, BC-ADM, CDCES to learn about the FreeStyle Libre 3 system, the smallest and thinnest sensor available that provides minute-to-minute glucose readings that stream directly to the users' compatible smartphone. Amy will give an overview of the system and share her approach on training her patients on the device. She will also answer any questions about utilizing the system in her practice.
50eda5d6-9612-4158-a179-bbb251ce7d74.name: Danatech Device Training: FreeStyle Libre 3 system – Overview and Training

issuer.summary: issued by Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

entity.name: Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must complete the one-hour training and complete the post-event evaluation in order to earn this badge.

a65e52f0-1dce-47fb-9164-0ea9bd8608b5.description: This device training will showcase the latest advances with the FreeStyle Libre 2 continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) system and empower you to efficiently educate on the device and utilize LibreView reports, as well as the FreeStyle Libre apps, to improve diabetes care.
a65e52f0-1dce-47fb-9164-0ea9bd8608b5.name: Danatech Device Training: Getting to Know the FreeStyle Libre 2 System

issuer.summary: issued by Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

entity.name: Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

badge_template_activities.title: Upon completion of the one-hour virtual training, “danatech Device Training: Getting to Know the FreeStyle Libre 2 System - Optimizing Outcomes for Adult and Pediatric Diabetes Management" – attendees will be able to: Proficiently educate on use of the FreeStyle Libre 2 CGM System; Learn how to access and share data with caregivers through the LibreLinkUp app as well as healthcare providers/clinics through LibreView; Efficiently review and interpret CGM data from LibreView reports

0b50d0c9-df4d-4a21-ae45-8242a683ea84.description: Diabetes care and education specialists are increasingly seeing people with completely preventable type 2 diabetes and related health complications where the disease and complications have manifested as a result of excess weight and obesity. In our work with healthcare systems, organizations have expressed a strong need for a standard curriculum from ADCES to educate the broad HCP care team to apply best practices in excess weight and obesity management.
0b50d0c9-df4d-4a21-ae45-8242a683ea84.name: Person-Centered Care for Individuals who have Higher Weight: A Certificate Program

issuer.summary: issued by Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

entity.name: Association of Diabetes Care & Education Specialists

alignments.name: Joint Accreditation for Interprofessional Continuing Education
alignments.description: In support of improving patient care, ADCES is jointly accredited by the Accreditation Council for Continuing Medical Education (ACCME), the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE), and the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) to provide continuing education for the healthcare team.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a 35-question pre-test.
Complete 8 webinar modules (totaling 8 hours) covering all aspects of person-centered care for individuals who have higher weight.
Complete a 35-question post-learning assessment and pass with a score of 70% or better.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete diabetes prevention coursework in areas such as: collaboration and health education, using different teaching techniques; program retention; using motivational interviewing to support participant behavior change and retention; and growing your cultural competences in providing diabetes prevention.

skills.name: Cultural Competence For Health Care Providers

93599b4d-9466-474b-bec4-08f933acfc55.description: Join our flexible advanced online series on building your diabetes prevention program. Complete the online training coursework, and enjoy recorded webinars that will enhance your skills in starting and sustaining a diabetes prevention program. Our advanced building your diabetes prevention program training series includes skill building in session zero, increasing awareness, referrals and retention, and increasing payer coverage to your program.
93599b4d-9466-474b-bec4-08f933acfc55.name: Advanced Building Your Diabetes Prevention Program
